alert.note: Alert for Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 12 at 3:21AM MDT until October 13 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOWFALL EXPECTED IN PORTIONS OF THE BLACK HILLS TODAY INTO FRIDAY... .A potent storm system will bring heavy precipitation and strong winds to the region today through Friday. Rain has started across the Black Hills and southwestern South Dakota. As the morning progresses and colder air wraps into the system, rain will change over to snow in the Black Hills. Accumulating snow is expected over much of the Black Hills through Friday morning, particularly across higher elevations of the northern and central hills. Some snow will also be possible if rain changes to snow in the Black Hills foothills tonight. If this does occur, there may be light accumulations. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...The Wyoming Black Hills. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 6 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
